channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Black sacks of rubbish next to 31 Boxgrove Road., 22nd February
item.description:
The sacks are on the pathway that leads to Eynsham Drive. One is near to 31 Boxgrove Road and the other is nearer to Eynsham Drive. Lots of litter as well needs to be cleared.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Boxgrove Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin is full in the recycling needs to be emptied and needs to be clean, 22nd February
item.description:
This bin on the recycling needs to be emptied. It needs news stickers and to be clean to keep the environment clean and looking clean

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Full of rubbish dumped by drivers, 22nd February
item.description:
These roundabout from harrow manorway taking left onto Eastern way towards Woolwich is full of rubbish, even if it gets cleaned today tomorrow there will be rubbish, why not install cctv to fine drivers fly tipping in the area
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Byron Close, Thamesmead

item.title: Street Light not working, 22nd February
item.description:
Street Light not working - despite it being 'fixed' on 18 Feb - the light failed after the first rain. The sidewalk and parking area is pitch black, not safe!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brenchley Close, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signpost has been cut but part of it is still sticking out of the ground, 22nd February
item.description:
An old sign has been cut down but part of it is still sticking out of the pavement. We were walking on an evening and nearly tripped up over it. This is a busy pavement with many small children, old people, runners etc using it who might all be seriously hurt if they trip up over it. The edge also looks quite sharp so could cut someone. It’s also right next to the kerb so someone could easily fall into the road if they tripped over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 237, Croydon Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Inoffensive up to 2 metres off the ground

item.title: Large multiple potholes by bustop adamsrill road / perry rise, 22nd February
item.description:
These potholes have been here for weeks. Bizarrely, a repair van arrived and simply poured tarmac into the bottom of some ofvthe deepest holes. We are getting sprayed with dirty water and muddy gravel everyday as we walk past. People ate avoiding using the busstop! Disappointing as the problem is clearly known about!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Rise, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
